DDS_AsynchronousPublisherQosPolicy Struct Reference
[ASYNCHRONOUS_PUBLISHER]

<<eXtension>> Specifies the asynchronous publishing settings of the DDS_Publisher instances. More...


Data Fields

DDS_Boolean disable_asynchronous_write
 Disable asynchronous publishing.
DDS_ThreadSettings_t thread
 Settings of the publishing thread.

Detailed Description

<<eXtension>> Specifies the asynchronous publishing settings of the DDS_Publisher instances.

The purpose of this QoS is to specify whether asynchronous publishing is enabled for the DDS_Publisher. If so, the publisher will spawn a separate asynchronous publishing thread. This single thread is shared by all DDS_ASYNCHRONOUS_PUBLISH_MODE_QOS DDS_DataWriter instances that belong to this publisher and handles their data transmission chores.

This QoS also allows the user to adjust the settings of the asynchronous publishing thread. To use two different asynchronous publishing threads for two different DDS_DataWriter entities, the instances must belong to different DDS_Publisher instances.

DDS_Publisher must have asynchronous publishing enabled for its DDS_DataWriter instances to write asynchronously.

Entity:
DDS_Publisher
Properties:
RxO = N/A
Changeable = NO

Field Documentation

DDS_Boolean DDS_AsynchronousPublisherQosPolicy::disable_asynchronous_write
 

Disable asynchronous publishing.

If set to DDS_BOOLEAN_TRUE, any DDS_DataWriter created with DDS_ASYNCHRONOUS_PUBLISH_MODE_QOS will return DDS_RETCODE_INCONSISTENT_POLICY.

[default] DDS_BOOLEAN_FALSE

struct DDS_ThreadSettings_t DDS_AsynchronousPublisherQosPolicy::thread
 

Settings of the publishing thread.

There is only one asynchronous publishing thread per DDS_Publisher.

[default] priority below normal.
The actual value depends on your architecture:

For Windows: -2
For Solaris: OS default priority
For Linux: OS default priority
For LynxOS: 13
For Integrity: 80
For VxWorks: 110

For all others: OS default priority.

[default] The actual value depends on your architecture:

For Windows: OS default stack size
For Solaris: OS default stack size
For Linux: OS default stack size
For LynxOS: 4*16*1024
For Integrity: 4*20*1024
For VxWorks: 4*16*1024

For all others: OS default stack size.

[default] mask = DDS_THREAD_SETTINGS_FLOATING_POINT | DDS_THREAD_SETTINGS_STDIO
